labels.analysis: The SurveyMars MCP Server is primarily designed for creating, distributing, and analyzing surveys through APIs. It allows users to integrate survey capabilities into their MCP clients, enabling the creation of unlimited surveys, questions, and responses, along with advanced analytics tools. The server is focused on streamlining survey workflows and gathering insights efficiently.
labels.reasoning: The primary category is chosen because the server's main functionality is centered around surveys, which involve data collection and analysis. Secondary labels include tools related to API integration and data processing. No custom label is necessary as the predefined categories adequately cover the server's functionality.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: SurveyMars MCP Server

server_info_crawled.overview: Enable seamless creation, distribution, and analysis of surveys through SurveyMars APIs. Integrate powerful survey capabilities directly into your MCP clients to gather insights quickly and effortlessly. Streamline your survey workflows with unlimited surveys, questions, responses, and advanced analytics tools.

tools.name: survey_create
tools.description: Deploy Server SurveyMars MCP Server @surveymars/surveymars-mcp Try in Playground survey_create

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@surveymars/surveymars-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
